intro: Heliopsis buphthalmoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf heliopsis, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in open, sunny areas such as prairies and disturbed soils. Heliopsis buphthalmoides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
